item.title: Hitachi drives are endorsed with a vote of confidence
item.description: In a January 2014 blog post, cloud storage company Backblaze reported that Hitachi and Western Digital hard drives have been the most reliable in their data centers. Backblaze engineer Brian Beach revealed that Seagate’s 1.5TB drives had an annual failure rate of about 14%, significantly higher than Hitachi’s 2TB drives at approximately 1% and Western Digital’s 1TB drives at 3%. For 3TB drives, Seagate again had the highest failure rate at around 9%, while Western Digital stood at about 3% and Hitachi at roughly 1%.
